title: ICE canola futures close lower in muted session
text:
ICE canola futures close lower in muted session

Forex 1 hour ago (Sep 26, 2019 18:30)

© Reuters. ICE canola futures close lower in muted session (All figures in Canadian dollars unless noted) CALGARY, Alberta, Sept 26 (Reuters) - ICE (NYSE: ) Canada canola futures closed lower on Thursday in what industry sources said was a quiet session. * The benchmark November canola futures contract RSX9 closed down $1.30 at $447.60 per tonne. * Trading in canola has been fairly rangebound in recent sessions. One industry source said that although there were concerns about bad weather in Canada, they were not pushing canola prices higher because the crop is fairly tough. * The November-January RSX9-F0 canola spread traded 3,019 times, closing at a $9.00 January premium, widening from $8.80 on Wednesday. The January-March spread RSF0-H0 traded 1,020 times. * Chicago Board of Trade November soybeans SX9 settled lower at US$888-1/2 a bushel. SOY/C * The Canadian dollar was little changed against its U.S. counterpart, with the currency pulling back from an earlier 10-day high as investors weighed U.S. political uncertainty. CAD/

ICE canola futures close lower in muted session
description: ICE canola futures close lower in muted session
